title: Zlatan Ibrahimovic vows to quit at the top — just like fellow Manchester United talisman Eric Cantona did
text:
Sport Zlatan Ibrahimovic vows to quit at the top — just like fellow Manchester United talisman Eric Cantona did "I'm a lion. If I don’t perform, don’t bring results, I will not play" says the Reds' 35-year-old Wembley match-winner Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Zlatan Ibrahimovic hails Manchester United's EFL Cup win Share this video     
They share the same brooding intensity and unashamed sense of self-worth. 
Both have an unique aura about them on and off the pitch, their charisma, talent and stature marking them out as true football icons. 
The comparisons between Zlatan Ibrahimovic and Eric Cantona are compelling, with the former proving just as pivotal to Manchester United as the latter. 
Cantona was credited with being the catalyst for the unprecedented success United enjoyed under Sir Alex Ferguson, his goals and influence ensuring he became an Old Trafford legend. 
Ibrahimovic is the talismanic figure leading United’s re-emergence from the fallow years they have endured in the wake of Ferguson’s retirement, with a Cantona-esque swagger on the pitch. Eric Cantona was the pied-piper for a golden generation of Old Trafford kids (Photo: Mirrorpix) 
Indeed, if there was a collar on the current United shirt, you sense Ibrahimovic would turn it up just like Cantona, the idiosyncratic ritual another way he had of making him stand out. 
And, just like Cantona, who quit football at 30 when he decided to leave United, Ibrahimovic has also vowed to go out while still at the top, rather than trade on his name at a lower level. 
Ibrahimovic provided further proof of his enduring worth with two goals in United’s thrilling 3-2 EFL Cup final win over Southampton on Sunday, including a dramatic 87th-minute winner. 
The iconic Swede, 35, has plundered 26 goals in a remarkable debut season and is almost single-handedly dragging United back to the top – just like Cantona more than 20 years ago. 
“What I bring, I bring a package,” said Ibrahimovic. “I bring my experience from the other clubs I’ve been in, I bring what I have achieved, I bring the person that I am. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Zlatan reveals where he keeps all his medals Share this video Watch Next 
“People always say I’m difficult to handle and that I have a different character, but I still won wherever I went. 
“I feel in good shape and I train hard. People who know me from the locker room know that I train very hard. 
“I’m a lion and I will stop on top. I will not play one game by being Ibrahimovic and for what I did before. If I don’t perform, if I don’t bring results, I will not play. 
“I will not be like other players, playing because they make a great career and name and they are still playing because they are who they are. I will play as long as I can bring results.” 
Ibrahimovic is inspiring United’s current crop of young players such as Anthony Martial, Marcus Rashford and Jesse Lingard, in much the same way Cantona did for the Class of ‘92 that included David Beckham, Ryan Giggs and Paul Scholes. Ibrahimovic is now setting the standards for the likes of Anthony Martial (Photo: REUTERS) 
Those former United stars have all paid tribute to the influence of Cantona, whose fierce work ethic and will to win rubbed off on all of them and made them better players. 
Ibrahimovic is the same, his talent matched by a hunger and desire on the training field that is leaving an indelible mark on United’s next generation. 
“I’m from the old school where they work hard and get what they get from doing the hard work, not like the new school where it’s easy to get what you want,” said Ibrahimovic. “I have an objective every season and to reach that objective I need to train hard and I need to suffer when I train. 
“In my head, I’m never satisfied - I always want more, I’m hungry to do more. That’s my mentality. I’m not satisfied with what I’m doing – I always want more. The Swede's first season in English football has brought the Community Shield... (Photo: Man Utd via Getty) ...and now the EFL Cup — late Ibrahimovic headers were the difference in both games (Photo: PA) 
“This is my 32nd trophy. I’ve been in five different countries, I’ve been in the best clubs in the world and I’m repeating, every year, what I’m doing. This is another chapter in my career.” 
Ibrahimovic has certainly vindicated the decision to come to England so late in his career, after glittering spells at Ajax, Juventus, Inter Milan, Barcelona and Paris Saint-Germain. 
But he admitted he could have been playing elsewhere had United boss Jose Mourinho – who managed him at Inter - not called and persuaded him to join him in Manchester. 
“In your career, you have moments,” said Ibrahimovic. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
